intro: Cyananthus microphyllus subsp. microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved bluebell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow, lanceolate, and densely arranged along the stem. The subspecies is distinguished by its reduced leaf size compared to other members of the species.
